http://www.spacewar.com/news/missiles-05zza.html
 
 They say in the Washington that the protege of the White House in Ukraine - Viktor Yushchenko - is always messing up and at last passed into a lossmaking project,.
 
 This time it is an urge by Japan that Ukraine investigates the alleged smuggling of 18 Kh55 (X-55) cruise missiles to Iran and China (and probably North Korea) between 2000 and 2001 (during Kuchma's era). These missiles were developed in the former USSR and are capable of carrying nuclear warheads.
 
 The Washington fears that if independent investigation of the case in Ukraine starts up, it will certainly become know that it was namely V. Yushchenko who first instigated smuggling weaponry back in the time when he was Governor of the National Bank of Ukraine and Prime Minister. Indeed, once V. Yushchenko won the "orange" revolution in Ukraine, this country became the weapon smuggling leader that continues its shadow cooperation with China, Iran and North Korea.
